intro: Paeonia corallina f. macrophylla, commonly known as the coral peony with large leaves, is a unique hybrid form of the coral peony. It is characterized by its striking coral-pink flowers and broad, lobed leaves that are larger than those of the typical species. The plant is native to China and thrives in well-drained, fertile soil with partial to full sunlight. It is a deciduous perennial that produces showy blooms in spring, making it a prized addition to gardens. Its botanical features make it a valuable subject for horticultural study and cultivation.
